title: Runes -correct builds.
body:
So after many people complaining about my runes I obviously realized I had totally screwed them up, been out of the game along time and need a heads up on how I should set my pages up.

ADC
AP
Tank
Support if there is such a one?

replies.body:
Take a 1% crit mark on your rune pages.

Don't ask just take it.
And keep it.

ADC:

9 X attack damage marks
9 X flat armor seals
9 X flat MR glyphs 
3 X attack speed quints 


AP:

9 X magic penetration marks
9 X flat armor seals
9 X flat Mr glyphs
3 X ability power quints

(as you get more IP and rune pages, you can swap armor for HP per level for when you're against another AP opponent) 


Support:

9 X flat armor marks 
9 X flat armor seals 
9 x flat MR glyphs 
3 x flat HP quints

(support pages can vary depending on the type of support you're playing. For example if you're playing someone like thresh, you can swap the armor marks for attack damage for better poke and easier relic shield minion procs) 


Tank: (for starters, you can use a similar Page to the support Page mentioned). Alternately you can go for a more scaling such as the one below:

9 X attack damage marks 
9 X scaling MR glyphs
9 x scaling HP seals
3 flat armor quints



If you only have about 3 rune pages for now, and limited IP, the 3 first pages mentioned are pretty standard and reliable for almost every situation. As you get more pages, you can customise your set ups to get more specific advantages in different matchups etc (such as going for CDR glyphs instead of MR glyphs when facing an AD opponent).

Ultimately it all comes down to personal preference, but here are some basic outlines to get you started. 

* AD page (cost all up= 8,610 IP)
**Quints** (big ones) - 3 x attack damage
**Seal** (yellow) - 9x armour
**Mark** (red) - 9 x attack damage
**Glyph** (blue) - 9 x magic resist

* AP page (cost all up= 10,455 or 12,300 if you go for AP over MP)
**Quints **(big ones) - 3 x ability power
**Seal** (yellow) - 9x armour
**Mark** (red) - 9 x magic pen
**Glyph** (blue) - 9 x magic resist or ability power

* Tank page (cost all up= 14,145 IP)
**Quints** (big ones)- 3 x armour
**Seal** (yellow) - 9 x HP
**Mark** (red) - 9 x armour
**Glyph** (blue) - 9 x magic resist

Personally I would sneak a few AD marks into the Tank page, but it is ultimately up to you. 

* Utility support (Utility page cost= 15,990 IP)
**Quints** (big ones)- 3 x AP or movespeed
**Seal** (yellow) - 9 x HP
**Mark** (red) - 9 x armour
**Glyph** (blue) - 9 x magic resist or scaling CDR or a mix of both

I usually just run my standard AP or tank page for my supports. 


>Note: all prices are estimates due to me using a S4 rune calculator

Good luck ♥
